column1: Tode was a marshy location mentioned in the The Shire-poem The Mewlips.
It is mentioned to be after a long road "beyond the Merlock Mountains"
column2: and "through the spider-shadows"; other than that it is unknown if Tode refers to an actual marsh in the Westlands
column3: or if it was just an invention by the poet.

column1: As the poem describes a location similar to Mirkwood
column4: the" its possible that Tode refers to the Long Marshes at the end of the Old Forest Road.
